0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Allergic contact dermatitis, Caused by poison oak, ivy, or sumac; Prophylaxis: apply a sufficient quantity to form a smooth film on skin at least 15 min before potential exposure; re-apply every 4 hr

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Allergic contact dermatitis, Caused by poison oak, ivy, or sumac; Prophylaxis: 6 years of age and older: apply a sufficient quantity to form a smooth film on skin at least 15 min before potential exposure; re-apply every 4 hr

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Allergic contact dermatitis, Caused by poison oak, ivy, or sumac; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to bentoquatam and any components of the products such as methylparabens

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• history of allergic-type responses to medications, especially topical formulations
  • open wounds, psoriatic lesions, or other cutaneous conditions
  • post-exposure to poison oak, ivy, or sumac (lack of efficacy)

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Topical: The mechanism of action is unknown. It is thought topically applied bentoquatam acts as a physical barrier that interferes with the adsorption of antigens onto the skin and reduces absorption of antigens into the skin. It probably does not work by modifying the systemic allergic response .

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: signs and symptoms of exposure to poison oak, ivy, or sumac

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient that this drug is used as barrier protection to prevent poison ivy, oak, or sumac rashes. Drug should not be used to treat an existing rash.
  • Warn patient not to use the drug in or near the eyes. If drug gets in the eyes, rinse them with cool water for at least 20 min.
  • This drug may cause erythema.
  • Apply at least 15 min before potential exposure to poison ivy, poison oak, or poison sumac.
